text.text_translated:
Lewis likes to see the number of marine protected areas rise from 3 % to 10 % of the world’s seas. Marine protected areas are places in the ocean set aside to keep wildlife safe. He wants to undo the damage that humans cause, such as overfishing, pollution and littering.  

During his trips, Lewis has seen this damage himself. He has swum over coral reefs. Coral reefs are living structures made of tiny sea animals that build hard skeletons. These reefs are bleached by warmer water. He also saw underwater deserts in the Red Sea. In these deserts, there was no life and plastic was everywhere.  

Pugh thinks that nature can recover if it is given enough space, but the clock is ticking. If we do not start caring for our seas, we may soon face a problem that is very hard to solve.
